titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania CAJS Rar Ms 283: Hādhā majmūʻ fī ʻilm al-taṣrīf.

notesStmt.note: Collective title from title page (f. 1r); titles of individual works from the introductions to those works.
Watermarked European paper: Mošin and Grozdanovic-Pajié Type VIII crown-star-crescent.

msIdentifier.repository: Library at the Herbert D. Katz Center for Advanced Judaic Studies

msContents.summary: Collection of works on Arabic grammar; copied in at least two hands.

author.persName: Ibn Masʻūd, Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī, active 13th century
Zanjānī, ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn Ibrāhīm, active 1257
Jurjānī, ʻAbd al-Qāhir ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān, -1078?
جرجاني، عبد القاهر بن عبد الرحمن،

respStmt.name: Dropsie College for Hebrew and Cognate Learning

supportDesc.extent: 83 leaves : 195 x 127 (145 x 65) mm bound to 194 x 140 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation added in pencil, upper left recto; catchwords every verso, lower left.

layoutDesc.layout: Chiefly written in 13 long lines; some pages border and frame ruled. Replacement pages written in 12 long lines. Some marginalia.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Chiefly written in nastaʻlīq in black ink; pointed and partially vocalized. Replacement pages written in naskh in black ink; pointed.

decoDesc.decoNote: Majority of the pages have the textblock border-ruled in double red with the page-opening frame-ruled also in double red (f. 7-73); rubrications in red; red dots mark poetry.

binding.p: Pages are loose and are held in covers with flap; marbled paper sides (mostly rubbed) and flap; reused paper scrap doublure; red leather spine and fore-edge hinges; labels on cover.

origin.p: The copy was completed in the month of Shawwāl, but the year is not legible; probably 17th century or 18th century (f. 44r)

history.provenance: Gift of Solomon L. Skoss to the library of the Dropsie College for Hebrew and Cognate Learning (note on library bookplate, inside front cover).
Formerly owned by the Dropsie College for Hebrew and Cognate Learning (library bookplate inside front cover).

surface.n: Inside back cover flap open to show design
Back cover flap opened to show design
Fore edge flap closed, inside front cover
